newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish Torm orders carrier in South Korea.
newsitem.headline: Danish Torm orders carrier in South Korea.

text.p: Denmark's Torm shipping company said on Wednesday that it and Sweden's Rederiaktiebolaget Gotland, Visby together ordered a twin-hulled 105,000 dead-weight tonne product carrier vessel from South Korea's Halla Shipyard.
Torm declined to give any price for the order, which it said was due for completion in the first quarter of 1999.

It said in a statement that at the same time it sold another 83,000 deadweight tonne carrier, jointly owned with Gotland, to foreign interests but would charter the vessel until the new South Korean-built tanker was delivered.

Torm said it expected the sale to have a positive effect on its half-year result and that the transactions were part of its policy to renew its tanker fleet. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969652
